CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant entered into a contract with ORG . Under the terms of the contract , the applicant bought CARDINAL chicks from the company which she was to raise for DATE . Subsequently , the applicant was to deliver the chickens to the company against a payment of an agreed price . In DATE the applicant purchased foodstuff from a company in ORG to feed the birds . Subsequently , PERCENT of the chicks died .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a compensation claim with the ORG against the company producing the foodstuff . She asserted that her chicks had died as a result of being fed the foodstuff purchased from the company . The defendant company contested its liability for the damage sustained by the applicant . On an unspecified date the applicant increased her claim .

CARDINAL . The first hearing was fixed for DATE , but ORG adjourned it due to the applicant ’s absence . However , it appears that the applicant ’s lawyer was present at that hearing . The next hearing was held on DATE . On DATE ORG visited the site . Subsequent hearings were held on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL May and DATE , DATE and DATE . On CARDINAL DATE one of the experts was heard by ORG at the Suwałki ORG request .

CARDINAL . ORG ordered the preparation of CARDINAL veterinary reports . On DATE it ordered that a second report be drawn up . However , that report was only submitted to the court on DATE . The preparation of a third report was ordered on DATE at the applicant ’s request as she had contested the expert findings in the previous reports . The third report was submitted to the court on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered its judgment . It awarded the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , which represented PERCENT of the compensation sought , together with statutory interest . It ordered the applicant to pay ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL for the outstanding court fee . It also held that the applicant was not required to reimburse the litigation costs of the defendant company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an appeal against ORG judgment . The defendant company also filed an appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance judgment for the most part . It amended it only in respect of the litigation costs of the defendant company . It ordered the applicant to cover a part of those costs ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) , having regard to her difficult financial situation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a cassation appeal with ORG against the judgment of ORG . On DATE , in reply to her query , the applicant was informed by ORG that due to the large number of cassation appeals pending before that court a hearing would be held DATE from the date of lodging the cassation appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . It dismissed the applicant ’s cassation appeal on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Suwałki Regional Court issued an execution warrant on behalf of the applicant . On DATE the Bailiff of the ORG stayed the enforcement proceedings at the applicant ’s request . On DATE and DATE the applicant requested ORG to amend the execution warrant due to the change of the defendant company ’s name . That warrant was issued on DATE . On DATE ORG judgment of DATE was successfully enforced .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at the applicant ’s request , the President of the Suwałki Regional Court suspended until DATE the obligation to pay the court fees . On DATE the applicant paid ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL as part of the outstanding court fees . On DATE the President of ORG agreed that the applicant could pay the remaining court fees in DATE instalments .

CARDINAL . NORP The legal provisions applicable at the material time as well as matters of practice concerning the remedies against unreasonable length of proceedings are set out in paragraphs CARDINAL of the judgment delivered by ORG DATE in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .
